snippet: MURPHY--Arthur W.,93, Professor Emeritus of Columbia Law School, died on January 16th. He was a graduate of Boston Latin School, Harvard University, and Columbia Law School (Class of 1948). A veteran of the 17th Airborne Division in WWII, he joined the faculty of Columbia Law School in 1963 after stints at the U.S. Department of Justice and in private practice. Professor Murphy taught until four years ago, becoming, at 89, the oldest active professor in the history of the Law School. Survived by wife Jean, children Lois, Rachel, and Paul; sons- in-law Peter and James; grandchildren Matthew, Elizabeth, Keith, Julia, Alexander, and Nicholas; and great- grandchildren Kayla, Autumn, and Zoe. A memorial at Columbia Law School will be announced as soon as plans are completed. 1/3
lead_paragraph: MURPHY--Arthur W.,93, Professor Emeritus of Columbia Law School, died on January 16th. He was a graduate of Boston Latin School, Harvard University, and Columbia Law School (Class of 1948). A veteran of the 17th Airborne Division in WWII, he joined the faculty of Columbia Law School in 1963 after stints at the U.S. Department of Justice and in private practice. Professor Murphy taught until four years ago, becoming, at 89, the oldest active professor in the history of the Law School. Survived by wife Jean, children Lois, Rachel, and Paul; sons- in-law Peter and James; grandchildren Matthew, Elizabeth, Keith, Julia, Alexander, and Nicholas; and great- grandchildren Kayla, Autumn, and Zoe. A memorial at Columbia Law School will be announced as soon as plans are completed. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  MURPHY, ARTHUR W.
